Photo of Topgolf - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Bridgeville, PA, United States

DWSafuD8BJ08O5WYFZYYWQ.text: Really cool, it is more like bowling than actual golf.  It's expensive for small groups but not bad for 4+ people.  The food was good too.

5Ac8529AhsirdUh3tf47_Q.text: So much fun!  Even if you're not a golfer the games you play here are a lot of fun.  You have a server at your bay for drinks/food, and to help you with the game if you need it.  So far we've tried a good amount of the appetizers and they are great.  Highly recommend the buffalo chicken flat bread!  We will definitely be regulars here.

Bi1mvPBx3cDdAx2yVCiGng.text: We visited Top Golf on a Friday night and i thought the idea of the golf experience was a great concept.  We had a reservation for 3 hours with drink and food service.  The drinks flowed easily and our waitress, Leah, could not have been sweeter.  She was very personable and extremely competent at her job.  We had a taco bar which was very good as well.   That being said, I can only give Top Golf a 2 star review because of the music.  It was so loud that we couldn't even hear each other talk and golfing with it was impossible.  Even the wait staff said it had never been that loud before.  Not sure what the management was thinking.  I understand that they have the dance floor but did the Deejay have to blast it thru out the whole establishment!  We were there to celebrate a recent couple's engagement and some family members were meeting for the first time-not very conducive to carrying on a conversation! I was very disappointed because of this and could not recommend it especially since it is rather pricey for what we got.

f7lHA_otNiWcrYz1ThTtvw.text: Very disappointed in the thievery that happened to our wedding party group after booking a bay for this upcoming Saturday. We booked the lane with a deposit of $200 for a 2 hour visit. With noticing we would not have enough time to travel to our wedding location after golf, we decided needed to push the day back that we would come visit the facility. The person we spoke with, Jessica, would not let us change the date or give us any credit to use at a later date. The only option given to us would be pay even MORE money to move the date. Needless to say they just robbed our group of $200, and now none of us or our friends will be visiting a Top Golf location.

FI9nh4W9zdgyHsho2z3hjg.text: Eric the manager on staff was incredibly helpful! We had an issue with one of the waiters but he cleared it up quickly. Our family had a great time golfing and enjoyed the food!

iMV__6GrvxPLPoAQNc9opw.text: Resevation fee will double your cost and it's not A for sure start time you may still have to wait....  Was looking forward to trying this place out. 1st attempt was last minute and we was told we would have to wait at least 45 minutes. Reasonable enough like it's a new place in town we arrived last minute but decided not to wait, not personally an atmosphere for me crowded and hectic and unclear instructions at the door. "One check in over her and the other stand over here"... I don't get it if we both need a membership shouldn't  both of us go o checkout? Oh and we have to stand over there for almost an hour? "No we can text you when a bay is available"...not for that so I can get annoying text later no way...just a quick nutshell of 1st attempted, bad on us last minute showing up expecting a good time...  2nd attempt- make a reservation in advance 7 days. Easy enough....READ fine print catch that could rip you off...$25 or whatever your reservation fee does not count towards cost of bay rental. So $25 to reserve add another $25 when u get there for your time wich may not happen and if you haven't gotten your membership yet add another $10. $60 in total for two because making a sketchy you still may have to Waite in a line reservation cost you as much as the bay rental WTF....TURN OFF, reservation canceled thankfully reread fine print before i over paid.

Boluute8iezPppFIHToc3Q.text: I recently visited Top Golf with my wife (she doesn't know we're married, long story) and we had an interesting time. You have to wave your club over the ball sensor about 2,374 before a ball comes out. At least 30 minutes of our hour was spent trying to figure out who's turn it was. Occasionally two balls would come out simultaneously. That really confused my "wife" and I. We accidentally started hitting shots for the other person so our scores were inaccurate. This wouldn't have been a problem except for the small detail that my "wife" is insanely competitive and I was on pace to break the all time high score in TopGolf history. This led to a huge argument between the two of us on the way home. When I got home I tried to apologize to my "wife" and comfort her with a hug and a kiss. She brushed me off then left our house with my dog. Now I have no "wife" and no best friend. Thanks for ruining my marriage and having my best friend taken away from me. If you get me a new puppy, all will be forgiven. We should have gone to Chuck E Cheese. Unfortunately I'm not allowed within a hundred yards of any Chuck E Cheese location in the greater Pittsburgh area. On the plus side the pretzel bites were absolutely sublime. 5 stars!  Edit: I found my wife playing skeeball at Chuck E Cheese. She was having no issues getting the balls out of the machine. I had to wait for her for three hours as she let out her frustrations from TopGolf on that poor skee ball machine. She pummeled that skeeball ramp with wooden ball after wooden ball until she had to be forcibly removed because she was deemed "a threat to the children and Chuck". She was taken to the Scott Township police station where she was charged with aggrivated assault against the skeeball machine and wreckless endangerment of children. She was in jail for over 8 hours. It was a long wait. Speaking of waits.. I forgot to mention that we waited in line for a half hour. There were only 2 people in front of us. The woman working the front desk seemed as if she was playing a game called "suck at your job". She's really good at that game. Speaking of games. I really liked the different varieties of games you can play at TopGolf. Unfortunately I only had enough time for one game because you can only hit 12 shots in an hour. The Foosball table was a welcome reprieve from the terrifying looks I was getting from my "wife" as she seethed in anger. The water was on par with a bottle of Fiji and really kept me from becoming dehydrated because of all of the thrashing I had to do to just get one ball out of the machine. Speaking of machines, I saw a peasant there who had his own clubs and he played golf like a machine. I watched him play for a while and he was in a groove. Every shot this peseant hit was right at the center of the target. Until, you guessed it, he started having issues with the balls coming out too slow. At one point he started swinging with one leg while the other waved back and forth across the ball sensor. As I watched the peseant who brought his own golf clubs to TopGolf leave he was clearly frustrated with his sabotaged round that started off electric. The only thing I could compare this peseant to was tiger woods. Speaking of woods, the free woods you guys let people use were made in the early 90s. Next time I'm bringing my own clubs like that other peseant. Bathrooms were very nice! 5 stars!

TGP20mwRIkeI6DnxFkGivg.text: First experience extremely disappointing. Wait for a bay was quoted as 2 hours; we went downstairs to eat. Greeted fairly quickly, but the food took over an hour. After waiting 2 hours and 15 minutes, we were told that it would be another 30-45 minutes because people in the bays were extending their times.  During busy peak hours, they need to either quote more accurately or limit/ban extending time. Left without ever picking up a club; probably will not make the drive again.

E48HlQLs75uvKxiEOaHtww.text: Really really fun! Awesome to socialize, have some drinks and snacks and work on my swing. They gamify it in a way that makes it fun for all and enticing to keep at it. We went with a big family group the day before Thanksgiving and it was a hit for all ages - from 7 to 67!

6846TzDdXB8bWhh9Sbsneg.text: I've been to Topgolf 2 weeks in a row now; I am not a golfer by any means, but that doesn't stop me from having as much fun as the golfers in my party. I have no complaints about the games, the bays, or the clubs (and neither did the actual golfers with me). The only negative thing I could say is about the drink orders. The first time I went, I was told they could only make one margarita on the menu whenever there were 3-4 options. This was fine, but why? My friend also asked the difference between two separate drinks on the menu and was told they were the same exact thing? Also, the Tito's Top Bloody drink was ordered and to come with toppings of celery, bacon, pickle, lemon, etc; however none of the toppings were served with the drink. My next visit consisted of the same thing: the server asked if I wanted my margarita frozen, which I did, but it was brought to me "on the rocks" and I was told frozen was out of season. I didn't care too much, but the others in my party felt that this information should have been told to us before ordering, or the drink should have been taken off the bill. I'm still giving 4 stars because none of this ruined my night at all, just maybe the servers need to be more familiar with the menu?

R4tQ9ItyhIyMpnrC6xTisQ.text: If you have to be here for a birthday party on a Sunday during football don't go! And definitely not for one of the biggest Steeler games of the year! No sound for the game! Who would think this in Pittsburgh! I know Top Golf wants to be trend setting in Pittsburgh but when it comes to the Steelers get over your ridiculous millennial selves! It is a culture here not just something you view haphazardly at random intervals! Had to be there for a birthday party, just the like the other people in our group and I am sure lots of other people too! I know your corporate headquarters is in Dallas home of the fair weather Cowgirl fans but this is Pittsburgh! Steeler fans don't roll that way! Top Golf, put the sound on for the Steelers everywhere in the building! C'mon Man!!!

3eHEpsajlYnWfWySChgpog.text: Had a great time. Service and food was great. We had appetizers and entrees...all were reasonably priced. Bay host was very helpful. Golf was a ton of fun for all including ages from 7-48.  Great family fun!

EyHqxW7V1hBwLb5dn51KOg.text: My family and I were so excited to go to Top Golf, he was visiting for a short time from Japan but he really wanted to do this. We signed up for the 530 time, but when we got there the "system went down". They let us hit some balls but we waited 2 hours before they finally got the system working. We had planned on dinner after but ate there instead, food was okay, drinks were expensive, overall disappointing. I thought they would discount our game or food but just gave us the $5 membership card. Would give it another chance if all went more smoothly.

3wrchX8zkZ79kzZjUV-U2Q.text: Great atmosphere! Erin on the second floor the best waitress!!! Maegan on the rooftop is a slacker.

Mp0B93MyvT5P1uyleRCGCg.text: Very unorganized. The kitchen and bar gave us everything wrong. We had to wait an hour to get what we ordered and at that point our experience was ruined. Good idea, executed poorly. Won't be back.

RMYnAMSnTM7cMrQOhUGJiw.text: Worst experience ever!!! Walked in on a Saturday after saw online no need for reservation just come on in and there WERE NOT ENOUGH WAITERS to seat people so there were 18 parties ahead of us waiting and we were told it was a 2 hour wait. Meanwhile there were many of bays open!!!! The way the staff handled the situation was awful! They were clueless and clearly had no idea what good customer service was. The guy at the desk said "if our servers come in at 11 then we can start seating people... as in he wasn't sure if his employees would show up? Wtf  Then a bachelor party came over to us and told us they had been waiting for 2 hours!!! Who wants to do that when they are there for a party! Worst service ever! As a tourist I've been to many top golfs Vegas being one of my favorite and it get 10x more people then pitt and they still Some how manage to make everyone happy! Get it together Pittsburgh we weren't coming for food all we needed was a bay and someone to click start!!!!

lC7tNu7-z3sPiozyntKL5A.text: This was one of the worst customer service experiences of our life. We booked a private group for a pre wedding party months in advance. Due to wedding schedule complications, we were no longer able to make the reservation. We gave a 3 week notice of our cancellation and they refused to refund us the $200 deposit or work with us to refund in a gift card or extend the group event to another date. With most of us living out of town, they provided no solutions. Even though they were polite, they were not amiable. If you want ROBBED and treated unimportant as a customer, then feel free to plan events here. I will never attend a Topgolf and will share this experience with anyone that has an interest in TopGolf. Completely took $200 from us .

5jeQl-YH4K9rFPpE12KJdw.text: It's a great place to eat and enjoy with your family and friends. Loved their veggie burger and their potato nuggets. Just remember ask for wait time before you go because there can be a long queue. So plan in advance.

l3j5T3wBt-NqADBcBxY3Ng.text: Golfing is not my forte so you can imagine I was a little intimidated when this was the place I was going to.   When I got there I was greeted by friendly staff.  I did not need to be on the master circuit to enjoy the venue.  What  surprised me the most was the quality of the food.   The Eggs Benedict was one of the best I have had out, and the server was top rate.  I would certainly feel comfortable recommending Top Golf to friends, so I'd be happy to recommend to all of you!!!!

QKs24kfmWqfJnJbYVSWHpw.text: Invited some work colleagues out to Top Golf for a Friday lunchtime meeting to hit some balls and talk a little about business opportunities.  From the moment we arrived at Top Golf, we were hit by a wall of noise from the music and general operation of the location.  The check in process was tedious as the counter staff had to shout at us and we had to shout back just to be heard.  Pricing is generally reasonable, but it makes no sense why everyone needs to buy a membership to just hit a few balls.  Also, the lifetime and single use membership are both $ 5, but thankfully I can go to Top Golf in Sydney, Australia, since I bought a lifetime membership (why?).  Things went a little better when we got to the bay although it was clear most of the wait staff are not real happy to be there.  We had fun golfing, but again due to the excessively loud music, it was impossible to talk to anyone.  You couldn't speak with someone three feet away from you with out shouting.  Food was decent - one par with what you can get at an Applebees or TGI Fridays.  Unfortunately, they serve Pepsi products.  The golf itself was fine and fun, but again the excessive noise just ruined the entire trip.
